entry.value: from matplotlib import pyplot as plt%%00010from sklearn.metrics import confusion_matrix%%00010import numpy as np%%00010%%00010%%00010def plotConfusionMatrix(y_true, y_pred, classes, normalize, title, cmap = plt.cm.get_cmap("Blues")):%%00010 %%00010 cm = confusion_matrix(y_true, y_pred)%%00010 if normalize:%%00010 cm = cm.astype('float') / cm.sum(axis=1)[:, np.newaxis]%%00010%%00010 # print(cm)%%00010%%00010 fig, ax = plt.subplots()%%00010 im = ax.imshow(cm, interpolation='nearest', cmap= cmap)%%00010 ax.figure.colorbar(im, ax=ax)%%00010%%00010 ax.set(xticks=np.arange(cm.shape[1]),%%00010 yticks=np.arange(cm.shape[0]),%%00010%%00010 xticklabels=classes, yticklabels=classes,%%00010 title=title,%%00010 ylabel='True label',%%00010 xlabel='Predicted label')%%00010%%00010 plt.setp(ax.get_xticklabels(), rotation=45, ha="right",%%00010 rotation_mode="anchor")%%00010%%00010 fmt = '.2f' if normalize else 'd'%%00010 thresh = cm.max() / 2.%%00010 for i in range(cm.shape[0]):%%00010 for j in range(cm.shape[1]):%%00010 ax.text(j, i, format(cm[i, j], fmt),%%00010 ha="center", va="center",%%00010 color="white" if cm[i, j] > thresh else "black")%%00010 fig.tight_layout()%%00010%%00010 plt.show(ax)%%00010%%00010%%00010plotConfusionMatrix(input_table['state'], input_table['Prediction (state)'], ('Candidate', 'False Positive', 'Confirmed'), False, "J48")
